Hear<S>8085</S> this word<S>1697</S>, ye kine<S>6510</S> of Bashan<S>1316</S>, that are in the mountain<S>2022</S> of Samaria<S>8111</S>, which oppress<S>6231</S> the poor<S>1800</S>, which crush<S>7533</S> the needy<S>34</S>, which say<S>559</S> to their masters<S>113</S>, Bring<S>935</S>, and let us drink<S>8354</S>.
The Lord<S>136</S> GOD<S>3069</S> hath sworn<S>7650</S> by his holiness<S>6944</S>, that, lo, the days<S>3117</S> shall come<S>935</S> upon you, that he will take you away<S>5375</S> with hooks<S>6793</S>, and your posterity<S>319</S> with fishhooks<S>1729</S> <S>5518</S>.
And ye shall go out<S>3318</S> at the breaches<S>6556</S>, every<S>802</S> cow at that which is before her; and ye shall cast<S>7993</S> them into the palace<S>2038</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>. <sup>cast: or, cast away the things of the palace</sup>
Come<S>935</S> to Bethel<S>1008</S>, and transgress<S>6586</S>; at Gilgal<S>1537</S> multiply<S>7235</S> transgression<S>6586</S>; and bring<S>935</S> your sacrifices<S>2077</S> every morning<S>1242</S>, and your tithes<S>4643</S> after three<S>7969</S> years<S>3117</S>: <sup>three: Heb. three years of days</sup>
And offer<S>6999</S> a sacrifice of thanksgiving<S>8426</S> with leaven<S>2557</S>, and proclaim<S>7121</S> and publish<S>8085</S> the free offerings<S>5071</S>: for this<S>3651</S> liketh<S>157</S> you, O ye children<S>1121</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the Lord<S>136</S> GOD<S>3069</S>. <sup>offer: Heb. offer by burning</sup> <sup>this: Heb. so ye love</sup>
And I also have given<S>5414</S> you cleanness<S>5356</S> of teeth<S>8127</S> in all your cities<S>5892</S>, and want<S>2640</S> of bread<S>3899</S> in all your places<S>4725</S>: yet have ye not returned<S>7725</S> unto me, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>.
And also I have withholden<S>4513</S> the rain<S>1653</S> from you, when there were yet three<S>7969</S> months<S>2320</S> to the harvest<S>7105</S>: and I caused it to rain<S>4305</S> upon one<S>259</S> city<S>5892</S>, and caused it not to rain<S>4305</S> upon another<S>259</S> city<S>5892</S>: one<S>259</S> piece<S>2513</S> was rained<S>4305</S> upon, and the piece<S>2513</S> whereupon it rained<S>4305</S> not withered<S>3001</S>.
So two<S>8147</S> or three<S>7969</S> cities<S>5892</S> wandered<S>5128</S> unto one<S>259</S> city<S>5892</S>, to drink<S>8354</S> water<S>4325</S>; but they were not satisfied<S>7646</S>: yet have ye not returned<S>7725</S> unto me, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>.
I have smitten<S>5221</S> you with blasting<S>7711</S> and mildew<S>3420</S>: when your gardens<S>1593</S> and your vineyards<S>3754</S> and your fig trees<S>8384</S> and your olive trees<S>2132</S> increased<S>7235</S>, the palmerworm<S>1501</S> devoured<S>398</S> them: yet have ye not returned<S>7725</S> unto me, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>. <sup>when: or, the multitude of your gardens, etc. did the palmerworm</sup>
I have sent<S>7971</S> among you the pestilence<S>1698</S> after the manner<S>1870</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>: your young men<S>970</S> have I slain<S>2026</S> with the sword<S>2719</S>, and have taken away<S>7628</S> your horses<S>5483</S>; and I have made the stink<S>889</S> of your camps<S>4264</S> to come up<S>5927</S> unto your nostrils<S>639</S>: yet have ye not returned<S>7725</S> unto me, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>. <sup>after: or, in the way</sup> <sup>and have: Heb. with the captivity of your horses</sup>
I have overthrown<S>2015</S> some of you, as God<S>430</S> overthrew<S>4114</S> Sodom<S>5467</S> and Gomorrah<S>6017</S>, and ye were as a firebrand<S>181</S> plucked out<S>5337</S> of the burning<S>8316</S>: yet have ye not returned<S>7725</S> unto me, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>.
Therefore thus will I do<S>6213</S> unto thee, O Israel<S>3478</S>: and because<S>6118</S> I will do<S>6213</S> this unto thee, prepare<S>3559</S> to meet<S>7125</S> thy God<S>430</S>, O Israel<S>3478</S>.
For, lo, he that formeth<S>3335</S> the mountains<S>2022</S>, and createth<S>1254</S> the wind<S>7307</S>, and declareth<S>5046</S> unto man<S>120</S> what is his thought<S>7808</S>, that maketh<S>6213</S> the morning<S>7837</S> darkness<S>5890</S>, and treadeth<S>1869</S> upon the high places<S>1116</S> of the earth<S>776</S>, The LORD<S>3068</S>, The God<S>430</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>, is his name<S>8034</S>. <sup>wind: or, spirit</sup>
